question.title: Does android-pdf-viewer support 16K PDF page size? Getting rendering error
question.body:
I'm using the following dependency in my Android app:

implementation 'com.github.barteksc:android-pdf-viewer:3.2.0-beta.1'

It works well for regular PDF files.

However, when I try to load a PDF that has a very large page size (close to 16,384 x 16,384 pixels â€“ around 16K), it fails to load and throws an error.

Load pdf error
java.lang.RuntimeException: nativeOpenDocument failed (possibly due to large page size)
    at com.github.barteksc.pdfviewer.DecodingAsyncTask.doInBackground(DecodingAsyncTask.java:49)
    at com.github.barteksc.pdfviewer.DecodingAsyncTask.doInBackground(DecodingAsyncTask.java:25)
    ...

pdfView.fromAsset("large_page.pdf")
       .enableSwipe(true)
       .load();

question_comments.body: Can you try to use 'com.github.asadwaheed1:AndroidPdfViewer:v3.2.0-beta06' instead?

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: No implementation found for long com.shockwave.pdfium.PdfiumCore.nativeOpenDocument(int, java.lang.String)     at com.shockwave.pdfium.PdfiumCore.nativeOpenDocument(Native Method)     at com.shockwave.pdfium.PdfiumCore.newDocument(PdfiumCore.java:‌​135)     at com.github.barteksc.pdfviewer.source.AssetSource.createDocum‌​ent(AssetSource.java‌​:41)     ...
"16KB" is about a number of bytes - you're talking about a page which is 16K pixels wide and 16K pixels tall - that's very different.
